sub_topic: Finding the minimum spanning tree of a graph.
message_1:
A campus has 8 buildings which need to be interconnected by laying down cables. The cost of laying a cable between any two buildings is different. The costs are as follows: 

| Building | A | B | C | D | E | F | G | H |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| Cost to connect to A | - | 8 | 1 | 2 | 11 | 7 | 10 | 4 |
| Cost to connect to B | 8 | - | 6 | 7 | 5 | 4 | 6 | 8 |
| Cost to connect to C | 1 | 6 | - | 3 | 5 | 2 | 4 | 9 |
| Cost to connect to D | 2 | 7 | 3 | - | 4 | 1 | 3 | 7 |
| Cost to connect to E | 11 | 5 | 5 | 4 | - | 7 | 9 | 12 |
| Cost to connect to F | 7 | 4 | 2 | 1 | 7 | - | 2 | 8 |
| Cost to connect to G | 10 | 6 | 4 | 3 | 9 | 2 | - | 5 |
| Cost to connect to H | 4 | 8 | 9 | 7 | 12 | 8 | 5 | - |

What is the minimum cost to connect all 8 buildings using the minimum spanning tree algorithm?
message_2:
To find the minimum cost to connect all 8 buildings using the minimum spanning tree algorithm, we can use Kruskal's algorithm. First, we list all the edges in ascending order of their weights:

1. D-F (1)
2. A-C (1)
3. F-G (2)
4. A-D (2)
5. C-F (2)
6. D-G (3)
7. C-D (3)
8. G-H (5)
9. B-E (5)
10. C-G (4)
11. B-F (4)
12. A-H (4)
13. B-G (6)
14. B-C (6)
15. E-D (4)
16. F-H (8)
17. B-H (8)
18. D-H (7)
19. A-B (8)
20. A-F (7)
21. A-G (10)
22. E-F (7)
23. E-G (9)
24. E-H (12)

Now, we start adding the edges to the minimum spanning tree while making sure we don't create any cycles:

1. Add D-F (1)
2. Add A-C (1)
3. Add F-G (2)
4. Add A-D (2) - This would create a cycle with D-F and A-C, so we skip it.
5. Add C-F (2) - This would create a cycle with A-C and D-F, so we skip it.
6. Add D-G (3) - This would create a cycle with D-F and F-G, so we skip it.
7. Add C-D (3) - This would create a cycle with A-C and D-F, so we skip it.
8. Add G-H (5)
9. Add B-E (5)
10. Add C-G (4) - This would create a cycle with A-C, D-F, and F-G, so we skip it.
11. Add B-F (4)
12. Add A-H (4) - This would create a cycle with A-C and G-H, so we skip it.

Now we have a minimum spanning tree with the edges: D-F, A-C, F-G, G-H, B-E, and B-F. The total cost is:

1 + 1 + 2 + 5 + 5 + 4 = 18

So, the minimum cost to connect all 8 buildings using the minimum spanning tree algorithm is 18.
